intro: Complaya gracilis, commonly known as the slender complaya, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late summer. Native to the temperate regions of Europe, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial shade. The plant is often found in woodland edges and along stream banks, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat. Its aromatic foliage and showy blooms make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens.
